hedline.hl1: PC SALES STRONG IN LATIN AMERICA

abstract.p: International Data Corp says sales of personal computers in Latin America this year will increase by 30 percent over 1999; estimates laptop sales will increase nearly 50 percent over last year; growing Internet use is helping to drive sales; graph (S)

block.p: Sales of personal computers in Latin America this year will increase by 30 percent over 1999, according to the International Data Corporation. Laptop sales alone will increase nearly 50 percent over last year, IDC estimated. PC sales are rising, in part, because of falling prices and the increasing availability of systems in local stores, said Alexandra Martinez of IDC. She also said growing Internet use was helping to drive sales. America Online-Latin America, a unit of AOL, which has invested heavily in South America this year, reported that its fourth-quarter revenue rose 55 percent over the previous quarter.
